MAN UTD-BOUND FRED SUFFERS ANKLE INJURY

Brazil midfielder Fred has suffered an injury scare just one week before the World Cup in Russia gets under way.

Fred is on the cusp of a move to Manchester United, who announced earlier this week they had reached an agreement with Shakhtar Donetsk to sign the 25-year-old for a fee reported to exceed £50m.

Brazil team doctor Rodrigo Lasmar said: "Today Fred had trauma in his ankle but it is too early to say anything about it.

"Tomorrow we watch to see what happens and then decide if we need to do any exams or not but at the moment it is too early to say anything about him."

INTER TARGET £16M DEMBELE

Tottenham midfielder Mousa Dembele is a transfer target for Inter Milan, reports Gazzetta dello Sport.

However, the Serie A side face a struggle to land the Belgian through his agent Kia Joorabchian.

Inter believe they could land Dembele for around £16m, but Tottenham want nearly double that amount.

However, they may throw Joao Mario into a potential deal to land Dembele. Mario was on loan at West Ham last season.

MADRID WERE CLOSE TO LEMAR

Real Madrid were closing in on the signing of Monaco midfielder Thomas Lemar before the departure of Zinedine Zidane last week, reports L’Equipe.

The France international had reportedly already informed Zidane of his willingness to move to the Bernabeu and he would have been one of Madrid’s first signings of the summer in a deal worth around €60m.

The 22-year-old has been linked heavily with the European champions’ domestic rivals Atletico Madrid and Barcelona in recent weeks.

replies.msg:
GUTI SET FOR MADRID?

Guti will be the next Real Madrid coach, according to Murcia president Victor Galvez.

Madrid have not yet found a replacement for Zinedine Zidane, who handed in his resignation at the Bernabeu last week.

The European champions have been linked with a number of managers – Mauricio Pochettino was their first-choice target but they have been unable to prise him away from Tottenham – and it appears as though they will now promote Guti, who is currently in charge of their under-19s.

“Guti will not coach Murcia because he will be the Real Madrid coach. He was the coach that I wanted, it’s a shame that Zidane did not take two days more to make a decision,” Murcia president Galvez is quoted as saying in AS.

More details in tomorrow's Equipe on the Fekir to Liverpool deal. Confirmed that fee agreed on Thursday and medical was due to take place on Friday, but there were tensions behind the scenes on Friday.
Some reports that it was a financial issue raised by Fekir's people... #LFC

Liverpool reportedly exasperated by the whole thing but still expect a deal to be completed. Lyon's talk of false information on Friday, meanwhile, relates more to the price mentioned - 65m - than the fact that a deal will be done. #LFC

ironically at Lyon's home ground (speculation that it could all be timed for Fekir to get his emotional goodbye at the match) - and then France fly to Russia Sunday lunchtime. #LFC

Lainer close to Napoli

Napoli are edging closer to a deal worth €10m for RB Salzburg versatile right-sided winger Stefan Lainer.

According to Sky Sport Italia and other sources, the 25-year-old Austrian has already visited Naples and is impressed by the project under new boss Carlo Ancelotti.

Lainer can play in any role down the right, from full-back to the edge of a trident attack.

He provided two goals and an impressive 11 assists in 55 competitive games for RB Salzburg this season.

Inter, focus on sales for FFP: Zaniolo close to Sassuolo

Inter are currently focused on raising funds to meet their Financial Fair Play parameters. Prospect Nicolo’ Zaniolo, born in ‘99, could be heading to Sassuolo in a deal similar to the one that would send Radu and Emmers to Genoa for a combined €10 million. Inter is expected to keep a buy back close on all theee players.

VALVERDE ASSURED OVER ARRIVALS

Barcelona head coach Ernesto Valverde has been assured Antoine Griezmann and Clement Lenglet will join the club this summer, reports Catalunya Radio.

Barca’s sport manager Pep Segura has guaranteed Valverde will be able to call upon the French pair, who are currently contracted to Atletico Madrid and Sevilla respectively.

Barca have reportedly reached an agreement with Lenglet and are willing to activate the buyout clause in his Sevilla contract before Manchester United make their move.

Meanwhile, centre-backs Yerry Mina and Thomas Vermaelen could leave the Camp Nou this summer.
West Brom have made a £7m bid for Bristol City forward Bobby Reid, according to Sky sources.

Manchester United have been given the chance to sign Bayern Munich striker Robert Lewandowski, according to Bild.

However, Bayern Munich will not listen to offers of under £175m for the Poland international.

Mario Gotze has refused to rule out a reunion with former Borussia Dortmund manager Jurgen Klopp at Liverpool.

The 2014 World Cup winner rose to prominence under Klopp at Dortmund and has left to open to a potential move to Anfield.

“I decided to leave Bayern and Jurgen Klopp was interested in getting me to Liverpool. And I was also interested in working with him again,” Gotze told the DAZN documentary ‘Being Mario Gotze’.

“It’s still existing. He is a world-class coach and that’s why it’s always an option.”

Watford and Barcelona have reached an agreement over the transfer of Gerard Deulofeu, reports Sport.

The Spanish winger, who spent part of last season on loan at Watford, will move to Vicarage Road on a permanent deal worth €13m plus add-ons.

West Ham make initial offer for Lazio's Felipe Anderson: the situation

West Ham have officially begun their pursuit of Felipe Anderson, making an offer of €20m plus add ons to Lazio for the Brazilian. Lazio value the player at double that amount, so there remains a sizable difference between the sides. The negotiations have just begun, but West Ham seem unwilling to go beyond €30m in order to land the Lazio attacking playmaker.

replies.msg:
Sampdoria-Arsenal, negotiation for Torreira continues

Arsenal continue to. pursue Lucas Torreira. The Gunners have identified the Uruguayan player as an ideal addition to their midfield, and while Torreira has a €25 million exit clause, if would have to be paid in one installment. Arsenal are willing increase their offer to €30 million to pay it over multiple years, a solution that would work for Sampdoria.

Arsenal however have yet to reach an agreement on personal terms with the player, at the moment Torreira’s agent’s demands are considered high, so the deal to bring the midfielder to London can not be considered in the closing phase quite yet.

https://gianlucadimarzio.com/en/sampdoria-arsenal-negotiation-for-torreira-continues

WOLVES CLOSE ON JIMENEZ

Wolves are closing in on the signing of Benfica forward Raul Jimenez, according to Sky sources.

The 27-year-old is set to join the newly-promoted Premier League club on a season-long loan.

CITY IN THE MIX FOR SERI

Jean-Michael Seri is available at £35m and in a further twist, his next destination could be influenced by the arrival of Patrick Vieira as the new head coach at Nice.

Vieira has strong links with Manchester City, having managed their sister club New York City in the MLS.

Sky Sports News understands City are keeping tabs on Seri's situation, as they continue to try and push through a deal for Napoli's Jorginho.
OFFICIAL: Hoffenheim have signed midfielder Vincenzo Grifo from Borussia Monchengladbach. #TSG #BMG

CHELSEA, ARSENAL STILL KEEN ON SERI

Chelsea and Arsenal remain interested in signing Nice midfielder Jean-Michael Seri, according to Sky sources.

The managerial situation at Chelsea remains uncertain, however, which could prove a stumbling block to any move for Seri.

Arsenal are understood to be looking at several players, and their interest in Seri is through Head of Football Relations Raul Sanllehi, who almost signed Seri last summer while working for Barcelona.

Newcastle United to monitor Marcus Rashford’s Manchester United situation

Newcastle United will monitor Marcus Rashford’s situation this summer as they continue to weigh up their striking options.

The Magpies have been linked with a loan move for the England striker, who is attracting the attention of a number of clubs after a chequered season with Manchester United.

https://www.shieldsgazette.com/sport/football/newcastle-united/newcastle-united-to-monitor-marcus-rashford-s-manchester-united-situation-1-9200830

UEFA sanction will not alter PSG's plan for Neymar

Despite Paris Saint-Germain receiving another sanction from UEFA for breaching Financial Fair Play rules, it will not alter their future plans with their star man Neymar.

Last Friday, the body established to regulate clubs' finances, gathered for a meeting and it looks like the worst scenario, which was to have PSG excluded from the Champions League, has been ruled out.

In principle, the punishment will go in line with what was already applied to the Parisian club in 2014, but more severe. If at that time PSG were allowed a deficit of 60 million in the balance between purchases and sales of players, this time it could be zero.

In other words, the French side would be restricted to buying players for the same amount as the ones they sell, with the need still to pay the transfer of Kylian Mbappe, which is 145 million euros plus 35 in bonus.

http://www.marca.com/en/football/real-madrid/2018/06/12/5b1ec43422601dd14d8b45a1.html

Kevin Mirallas is set for talks over this Everton future.

The Blues are looking to reduce a bloated 38 man squad and slash their £139m wage bill this summer.

Mirallas is contracted until June 2020 but has fallen out of favour at Goodison and spent the second-half of last season out on loan at Olympiakos.

Preston's Greg Cunningham is looking likely to leave the club this summer.

The left-back is on his last year of his contract and does not look like signing a new one. He could complete a £4m to Cardiff soon.
